title: Remedial Massage Courses Sydney | ANTA Recognised Courses
description: Browse ANTA approved, high-quality remedial massage courses in Sydney + learn how to practice remedial massage and the key skills needed.
cleaned_text: highly technical knowledge and unique skills. Training can include anatomy, physiology, and pathophysiology, which allows the student to understand how the body works, and makes them an effective massage therapist. With these skills, you can really improve the quality of people's lives, especially those who have been suffering in pain for a long time. Remedial massage therapists can specialise in a number of areas, including chronic or terminal illnesses, palliative care, allied health, or sports and injury management. You can work in environments like sports centers, hospitals, health and wellness clinics, and more. Or if you'd like to be your own boss (and are ready for some hard work), you can even start your own company. The massage therapy industry is estimated to increase by 15% in the next five years, according to the Australian Government's Job Outlook service. Remedial massage therapists earn up to $1,038 per week on average, which rises with experience. There's currently 19,000 remedial massage therapists in Australia, and to join them, you will need to undergo a Diploma of Remedial Massage (you can find full info on this below). Course Provider : Western Sydney University Campuses :NSW A remedial massage therapist uses various massage techniques to diagnose and treat biomechanical problems in the body. They use their thumbs, knuckles, and elbows to apply pressure to the muscles and connective tissues, which can provide enormous relief to the patient, and help to resolve issues. From day to day, a remedial massage therapist can find themselves completing the following activities: As a remedial massage therapist, you'll have a number of workplaces to choose from. These are some of the most common. Health and wellness clinics can be found in every city in Australia. They're a popular place for people to relax and unwind, and cure any ongoing health issues that they may have. You'll use a number of massage techniques to help achieve this, and to provide a soothing experience. These clinics also tend to hire other natural therapy practitioners, such as homeopaths, nutritionists, chiropractors, and osteopaths, who you'll have the opportunity to work alongside. Clinical settings like hospitals and aged care facilities hire remedial massage therapists, as a way to help people get through palliative care, and provide relief from chronic illnesses. If you'd like to go it alone, you can start your own business. You'll need to learn and run every component of the company, including marketing, financials, and obviously the massage work itself. Business owners often have to work hard early on while they build their company, but the rewards can be great. In Australia, remedial massage therapists usually complete a Diploma of Remedial Massage through an RTO (registered training organisation). If you're looking for remedial massage courses in Sydney for this diploma, check out our course finder further up the page. This course is a nationally-recognised pathway to becoming a remedial massage therapist. It provides you with a deep level of understanding for massage and how it can help to heal the body. Course duration: 12-18 months Study mode: on campus and online learning Entry requirements: Year 12 or equivalent Units of study: The Diploma of Remedial Massage course is usually made up of 21 units, with 16 core units and five elective units (one of these must be from the Business Management group). Four elective units can also be from an endorsed Training Package or accredited course, and must be relevant to the work outcome. Electives must also contribute to a valid, industry-supported vocational outcome. Core units Elective units - Business Management Elective units - Other
